title: [Large-Scale] Hybrid Mathematics Learning Course Quality Improvement Design: Strengthening Formula, Graph, and Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level mathematical foundations (equations, functions, geometry, statistics) and basic computational proficiency
context.additional_context: A blended learning curriculum combining online/in-person instruction with QM (Quality Matters) standards. Integrates proof-solving, problem-solving, and data analysis activities for math concepts.

learning_goals: Learners participate in real-time discussions and collaborative activities with ≥85% engagement in online learning environments, improving their ability to apply equations and formulas for mathematical problem-solving.
Through module-based formative assessments, learners achieve ≥70% proficiency in applying mathematical concepts (functions, geometry, statistics).
Learners adapt to hybrid class structures, improving learning efficiency (e.g., graph interpretation, calculation problem-solving) by ≥20% when transitioning between online and in-person activities.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
